representation_information.name: AMR-WB, Adaptive Multi-Rate - Wideband Speech Codec (G.722.2)
representation_information.description: Audio data compression scheme optimized for speech coding in GSM (Global System for Mobile Communications) and UMTS (Universal Mobile Telecommunications System), an elaboration of AMR. Compared to narrowband speech codecs (like AMR) optimized for traditional telephone voice quality of 300-3400 Hz, the AMR-WB codec's wider bandwidth of 50-7000 Hz provides excellent speech quality.

relation.title: Sustainability of Digital Formats: Planning for Library of Congress Collections
